code.displayName: Physician Assistants and Advanced Practice Nursing Providers
Physician Assistants and Advanced Practice Nursing Providers
Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: s:pt presents with moderate nausea for about 4 weeks. pt is a 68 yr old white f. o:Height 59 in, Weight 206 lbs, Temperature 98.9 F, Pulse 84, SystolicBP 111, DiastolicBP 73, Respiration 16, eyes = dilated pupil, Abdomen = non tender, non distended, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs a:Nausea p:performed E/M Level 3 (new patient) - Completed, and prescribed ondansetron - 8 mg 1-2 x day, and ordered Abdominal X-Ray.

s:a F aged 69 years describes recurrent mild vertigo over the past month. The pt reports mild nausea, mild diarrhea. o:Height 59 in, Weight 201 lbs, Temperature 97.9 F, Pulse 77, SystolicBP 106, DiastolicBP 66, Respiration 15, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Abdomen = mild tenderness a:Nausea p:performed E/M Level 3 (established patient) - Completed, and prescribed prochlorperazine - 40 mg daily (oral dose), and ordered Basic Metabolic Panel.
